skillTree.localised_description: "Da Big Boss getz da biggest barka', nuff sed."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: An even bigga wolf, this one's as large as a horse. And it's got armour on.

skillTree.localised_description: Sneakily stolen from Ghazak Khan, Terror of the East. This red, curved sword, notched in hundreds of savage battles by the Khans of the Blackwolf clan, has acquired a dire reputation.
Give the boyz a fair share of da loot and one or two bitz from da pile of shiny stuff, dat should keep 'em loyal. Dat Boss Wossisname is a git anyway.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Goblin units and Characters
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A huge, horned helmet, decorated with a black wolftail, which holds a captured Wind Daemon of the eastern steppes.

Ten Goblins? Inconvenient.
	A hundred? Alarming.
	A thousand? 
	Uh oh!

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Goblin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss is especially sneaky, able to deploy deep in enemy gits' terrain before battle.
You can’t trust ‘im. E’s a little bit woaah, a little bit Waaagh! Ya know? Well dodgy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: How else is an ordinary, decent goblin to make an honest living in these hard, dark times?

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Goblin units and Characters
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "One of the eight spells is missing? Well that's rather badly organised."

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: +12.5% for all enemy spellcasters
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This one is slightly bigger than most other goblins.

"Flank 'em, shoot 'em, hit 'em 'ard, an' den do it again from annuvva angle. Of kourse, if da battle is goin' bad fer our side, I'm gonna keep ridin' an' act like I wuz never there, so yer'd betta stikk klose!"

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: "Don't be ridiculous. Dragons don't exist."
"Do you see the eighth colour? That's the colour of magic!"

skillTree.localised_description: The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Kruggler is the Griff's personal bodyguard, and leads his own pack of Wolf Boyz. While not very good at protecting his boss, he is good at flanking enemies.

attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
"Dere’s nuthin’ in life as proper as hunt’n from da back of a ‘ard taught wolf."

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Every cave and ditch is a hiding place for these Goblins - you cannot hit what you cannot see.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
These iron-hard gits are particularly tough and gnarly Greenskins, who - even if wounded - will be up and ready to fight before too long.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: They march because they're told to, and of course because they'll get a 'right proper thrashin'' if they don't.
Occasionally an Orc will come along who is more "kunning" than the rest. He quickly rises in ranks as his plans end in victory.
A Boss that has the loyalty of the mobs means he doesn’t have to worry so much about "da boring stuff" like tents and bedding, as they’ll fight for him no matter what.
Being green meanz ya really mean.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

nodes.localised_description: The more this general follows Da Plan, the better they get at using Gorbad's Tactics.

effects.description: Infinite duration for Da Plan Tactics
